Alloy Name: Mg-20 wt% Ti0.16 Cr0.24 V0.6 composite
Key Findings: Achieved 5.67 wt% H2 release in 20 min at 270 °C under 0.01 MPa.
Comments: Nanocrystalline composite via reactive ball milling.

Storage Capacity: 2.83 wt% at 150 °C; 6.18 wt% (initial), 4.98 wt% after 100 cycles
Synthesis Method: melt spinning (hydrogenated to FCC phase); melt spinning; Melt spinning (TiCrNbHx) followed by ball milling with MgH₂ (20 wt%)
Key Findings: Maximum hydrogen absorption of 2.83 wt% at 150 °C.; Catalyst enables MgH2 to absorb 2.83 wt% H₂ at 150 °C and lowers dehydrogenation Ea to 73.29 kJ mol⁻¹; TiCrNbHx‑MS lowers dehydrogenation enthalpy to 75.5 kJ mol⁻¹ H₂ and retains 81 % of 6.18 wt% H₂ after 100 cycles at 300 °C.
Comments: Fully converts to FCC hydride after rehydrogenation.; Composite recharges 4.3 wt% H₂ in 2 min at 150 °C; No new phases detected after 100 cycles; initial rapid capacity drop then stable performance.

Synthesis Method: Melt spinning; ball milling with MgH2; melt spinning followed by full hydrogenation
Key Findings: Ti45Cr40Nb15 melt-spun catalyst enables MgH2 composite to release 5.8 wt% H2 in 700 s at 230 °C and retain 4.98 wt% after 100 cycles.; Initial dehydrogenation at 163 °C; activation energy 73.29 kJ mol⁻¹; 81 % capacity retained after 100 cycles at 300 °C
Comments: FCC→BCC phase transformation during de-/rehydrogenation.; FCC TiCrNbHx‑MS transforms to BCC on dehydrogenation and reverts on rehydrogenation

Key Findings: Released 5.7 wt% H2 in 30 min at 290 °C; reabsorbed >90% capacity in 100 min at 100 °C.
Comments: Catalyzed MgH2, enhanced diffusion via nano/amorphous phases.
